definitions.meaning:
~ sth (to sb).  ~ what, how, etc.…概述；略述
to give a description of the main facts or points involved in sth

examples.content:
We outlined our proposals to the committee.
我们向委员会提纲挈领地讲了讲我们的提案。

definitions.meaning:
[usupass]~ sth (against sth)显示…的轮廓：勾勒…的外形
to show or mark the outer edge of sth

examples.content:
They saw the huge building outlined against the sky.
他们看见了在天空的映衬下那座巨大建筑的轮廓

definitions.meaning:
概述；梗概
a description of the main facts or points involved in sth

examples.content:
This is a brief outline of the events.
这就是事件的简要情况。

You should draw up a plan or outline for the essay.
你应该为文章草拟个计划或提纲。

definitions.meaning:
轮廓线；略图
the line that goes around the edge of sth, showing its main shape but not the details

examples.content:
an outline map/sketch
略图；草图

At last we could see the dim outline of an island.
我们终于能看到一小岛朦胧的轮廓了。
